steps

Class SynthGroups

  • java.lang.Object
    • steps.SynthGroups

  • public class SynthGroups
extends java.lang.Object
    SynthGroup manages the generation of synthetic data sets by taking the user step-by-step through the whole procedure from entering the project summary to writing the reulting data file. Altogether there are 9 steps, and proceeding to the next step is only possible after 'grammatically' correct input. At each step a context specific help screen is available. As result of the user responses at a given step, the entered data are stored, and the GUI scene for the next step is generated, and handed via 'main' back to the GUI. Users can step through the synthesis either manually, by entering the design information via keyboard and mouse, or they can pick the 'do-over' mode, where the program reads a control file, prepared in a previous synthesis run. The user just has to enter changes.
    Version:
    %v..%
    Author:
    ralph
    See Also:
    steps.SynthGroup

    • Method Detail

      • getGroup

        public javafx.scene.Group getGroup()
                            throws java.lang.Throwable
        This method uses the java 'switch/case' construct to make sure that it constructs the correct scene for a given step, based on the data entered previously. This scene is then handed back to 'main' that passes it to the GUI. The 'popup' call at each step collects ongoing status information, that can be optionally fed to a log file for diagnostic use. At each step 'getGroup' returns a JavaFX Group object, constructed as result of the the cumulative information entered. The 'Group' goes to 'Main', where it is packaged into a JavaFX 'Scene', which is then handed to the 'rootLayoutController'. Some steps can generate their 'Group' directly, others need the assistance of further methods contained in this package
        Returns:
        Group essentially the 'Scene' to be sent to the GUI
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - IOException

      • addComments

        private javafx.scene.Group addComments()
        Prompts for comments to describe the project. These comments form the leading lines of the 'COMMENT' section in the control file. These lines appear in the control file with the header 'COMMENT '. G_String then adds the facet names and their 1 char designations in the original facet order. These lines appear in the control file with the header 'COMMENT*'.
        Returns:
        Group essentially the 'Scene' for comment entry to be sent to the GUI

      • mainSubjectGroup

        private javafx.scene.Group mainSubjectGroup()
        Prompts for the main subject facet name, designation, and a choice between crossed and nested status. This method uses one 'facetSubForm' and one 'facetCountSubForm'.
        Returns:
        Group essentially the 'Scene' for main Facet entry to be sent to the GUI

      • subjectsGroup

        private javafx.scene.Group subjectsGroup()
        Prompts for the features of each additional facet, again in original facet order. This method uses as many facetSubForms as necessary.
        Returns:
        Group essentially the 'Scene' for other Facets entry to be sent to the GUI

      • facetGroup

        private javafx.scene.Group facetGroup(java.lang.String sCue,
                                      java.lang.Integer iFacetID)
        generates bound GUI sub form to specify each specific facet. iFacetID provides an index for the specific facet. It is used in both 'mainSubjectGroup' (x 1), and 'subjectsGroup' (x1 to many).
        Parameters:
        sCue - header string
        iFacetID - original order of new Facet
        Returns:
        Group essentially the sub -'Scene' for Facet details entry to be sent to the GUI

      • facetCountGroup

        private javafx.scene.Group facetCountGroup()
        Generates subform for spinner to enter number of additional facets. Is used once in 'subjectsGroup'.
        Returns:
        Group essentially the 'Scene' for facet count spinner entry to be sent to the GUI

      • headerGroup

        private javafx.scene.Group headerGroup(java.lang.String _sColumnHeader)
        Generates the subform for the header line in all subject forms.
        Parameters:
        _sColumnHeader - String containing column header text
        Returns:
        Group essentially the 'Scene' for facet form header entry to be sent to the GUI

      • orderFacets

        private javafx.scene.Group orderFacets()
        to set facet order and line change position. This group uses another standard javafx construct that we will use again: 'Grab and Drop'. A visual item can be 'grabbed' by clicking with the mouse button on it. The item then follows the mouse movement, and is then finally dropped, where the mouse button is released. see e.g. http://tutorials.jenkov.com/javafx/drag-and-drop.html In this, and the following group, items are moved from one cell in a list to another. Based on the new facet order, G_String creates a new dictionary 'sHdictionary', which lists the facet characters in hierarchical order, in contrast to 'sDictionary', which lists the facets in the original order, as they have been entered. The distinction is important for GS. The original order helps calling up facet properties, while the hierachical order is used for the algorithmic sequences!
        Returns:
        Group essentially the 'Scene' for Facets order entry to be sent to the GUI

      • setNestingGroup

        private javafx.scene.Group setNestingGroup()
        arranges nesting details, again using 'drag and drop'. But while in step 5 items were moved within the same list, in step 6 items are moved from the list on the left (nested facets) to the list on the right (crossed effects). However, the basic mechanism stays the same.
        Returns:
        Group essentially the 'Scene' for Facet nesting entry to be sent to the GUI

      • simpleVariableGroup

        private javafx.scene.Group simpleVariableGroup(java.lang.String _sType,
                                               java.lang.String _sName,
                                               java.lang.String _sTarget)
        generates bound GUI addition to specify one specific name - value pair and deposits the integer value in a designated target location. sType has to be either "Integer" or "Double". The result of appropriate type, however, is passed as a string to myNest.
        Parameters:
        _sType - variable type as String
        _sName - variable name as String
        _sTarget - name as String, where variable is to be stored
        Returns:
        JavaFX graph element to be used in GUI form

      • simpleVariableGroup

        private javafx.scene.Group simpleVariableGroup(java.lang.String _sType,
                                               java.lang.String _sName,
                                               java.lang.String _sTarget,
                                               java.lang.String sValue)
        generates bound GUI addition to specify one specific name - value pair and deposits the integer value in a designated target location. sType has to be either "Integer" or "Double". The result of appropriate type, however, is passed as a string to myNest.
        Parameters:
        _sType - variable type as String
        _sName - variable name as string
        _sTarget - name as String, where variable is to be stored
        sValue - variable value as String
        Returns:
        JavaFX graph element to be used in GUI form

      • filteredFacetList

        private javafx.collections.ObservableList<java.lang.String> filteredFacetList(java.lang.Boolean isNested)
        An 'ObservableList' is a Javafx construct that enables listeners to track changes in the list, when they occur. A ListChangeListener is an interface that receives notifications of changes to an ObservableList. This construct is used in the method 'setNestingGroup' for both the list of crossed and nested facets. That makes the visual arranging of facet nesting possible. Identical to the one in 'AnaGroups'.
        Parameters:
        isNested - Boolean
        Returns:
        filteredFacetList ObservableList

      • saveNested

        private void saveNested(javafx.collections.ObservableList<java.lang.String> _crossed)
        Saves the nested list to the 'Nest' repository, and returns it for further use in AnaGroups as a formal tree structure.
        Parameters:
        _crossed - observable list of crossed Effect descriptions

      • setSampleSize

        public javafx.scene.Group setSampleSize()
        G_String cycles through 'setSampleSize' until all the sample sizes for all facets (in hierarchical order) have been collected, when the variable 'bDawdle' turns to 'false'. The actual form is constructed as 'getPage' within 'SampleSizeTree', where the sample sizes are being stored as well.
        Returns:
        Group essentially the 'Scene' for setting sample sizes entry to be sent to the GUI

      • baseScaleGroup

        private javafx.scene.Group baseScaleGroup()
        Collects lower and upper score cutoff and targeted mean score
        Returns:
        Group essentially the 'Scene' for score range entry to be sent to the GUI

      • saveDataFile

        private void saveDataFile(java.lang.String _sFileName,
                          java.lang.Double[] _darData,
                          java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> _salCarriageReturn)
        Takes the abstract synthetic data set 'darData', adds the mean value, and constrains the output between maximum and minimum boundaries. Values get formatted and bundled into lines, each with an appropriate leader (that later will be ignored again in the analysis), and, finally, saved in a file with the chosen file name. A summary of the file will be displayed on the screen.
        Parameters:
        _sFileName - String
        _darData - Double[]
        _salCarriageReturn - ArrayList

      • repeatFocus

        private void repeatFocus(javafx.scene.Node node)
        A special javafx construct to defer operation until ready. See: https://riptutorial.com/javafx/example/7291/updating-the-ui-using-platform-runlater
        Parameters:
        node - Node
